metadata.synopsis: Default dialog with missing kid's (kidnapped by hag in BG) mother when she's at home

1.speaker: Lora
1.text: Have you found her? My daughter?

16.speaker: Lora
16.text: You're here! Does this mean you found my daughter? The Flaming Fist still have no clue. Useless twats.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You never told me you pulled out a knife in the Blushing Mermaid. Or that you used to be a pirate.
38.context: NodeContext: little taken aback at the beginning, player has called her out on her past - rushing to smooth things over

21.speaker: Lora
21.text: I'm not proud of my past, all right? I lived a violent life. But that all changed when I had Vanra.
21.context: NodeContext: little taken aback at the beginning, player has called her out on her past - rushing to smooth things over

52.speaker: Lora
52.text: Getting the occasional drink in the Blushing Mermaid is as close as I get to the old days.

12.speaker: Lora
12.text: As for pulling a knife... fine - I did. But! They wouldn't let me look for Vanra and I panicked. All right?

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Captain Grisly said you don't have a daughter.

3.speaker: Lora
3.text: How could she say such an awful thing?

57.speaker: Lora
57.text: I - I feel like I'm losing my mind. Vanra is real, damn it. All I want is for her to be home and safe - please.
57.context: NodeContext: shocked and upset, breaking down a little

72.speaker: Lora
72.text: I'd bet my last copper that Captain Grisly has something to do with this. Why else would she try to turn you against me?

48.speaker: Lora
48.text: You have to find her, you have to get Vanra back. Please, I'm begging you.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: What else have you lied about?

25.speaker: Lora
25.text: Nothing - I swear on every god in the realms. I just want to find my daughter!

28.speaker: Lora
28.text: Why does this keep happening? Why is no one listening to me?
28.context: NodeContext: upset, breaking down a little

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I'm actually here to kill you. Grisly made me an offer I can't refuse.

2.speaker: Lora
2.text: What? If this is a joke, it's not funny. Why would Grisly want me dead?

4.speaker: Lora
4.text: Oh, gods above - you're serious. HELP! HELP!
4.context: NodeContext: realise the player is about to kill her, panicked,

54.speaker: Player
54.text: A hag took her - I saw it with my own eyes.

70.speaker: Lora
70.text: A hag has her? Gods above.

40.speaker: Lora
40.text: What does a hag want with Vanra? My poor child...

56.speaker: Lora
56.text: You have to do something - you have to save her. I have no one else. Please, help my little girl. Please.

62.speaker: Player
62.context: NodeContext: just learned vanra is dead. that disbelief when your world is falling apart

11.speaker: Lora
11.text: No. She can't be dead... she can't be...
11.context: NodeContext: just learned vanra is dead. that disbelief when your world is falling apart

34.speaker: Lora
34.context: InternalNodeContext: Runs awayNodeContext: screaming with grief

0.speaker: Lora
0.text: Please, don't give up on her.

17.speaker: Lora
17.text: You brought her back - you brought back my sweet sweet girl.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving Vanra

18.speaker: Player
18.text: The hag was my problem to deal with.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving Vanra

63.speaker: Lora
63.text: It was everything. I'll never forget it.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Keep a closer eye on her in future.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving Vanra

20.speaker: Lora
20.text: I doubt I'll ever sleep again, for fear she'll be swiped from under my nose.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You're damn lucky I was here - she almost died.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving Vanra

13.speaker: Lora
13.text: And I will die, hopefully many years from now, with your name on my lips - forever grateful for what you've done for us.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving Vanra

24.speaker: Lora
24.text: Here - a token from the pirate life I left behind. Thank you - for being braver than half this city put together.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving Vanra

60.speaker: Lora
60.text: Here - a token from the pirate life I left behind. Thank you - for being braver than half this city put together.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving Vanra

14.speaker: Lora
14.text: Here - a token from the pirate life I left behind. Thank you - for being braver than half this city put together.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving Vanra

47.speaker: Lora
47.text: I wanted to thank you properly - had something to give you - but I've been robbed.

31.speaker: Lora
31.text: Hard to care about losing anything now I've got the one thing that matters back though.

23.speaker: Lora
23.text: You're really not big on social graces, are you? I can tell.

26.speaker: Lora
26.text: I'll be keeping a close eye on Vanra from now on - don't you worry.
26.context: NodeContext: sad smile - she knows it's too late

51.speaker: Lora
51.text: Unless you have news of my daughter, I don't want to hear it.

59.speaker: Lora
59.text: Tell me that hag didn't hurt my baby - please.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I'm working on a way to save her - don't worry.

35.speaker: Lora
35.text: When you walked in,  I was prepared for the worst. This waiting is driving me insane.

22.speaker: Lora
22.text: But waiting's all I can do. Please - find her.

64.speaker: Lora
64.text: Can you say anything else, Vanra? Anything but 'Mummy'?
64.context: NodeContext: vanra has returned, safe and sound, but can't say anything other than 'Mummy'. Speaking to vanra, gentle and soft - like she's speaking to a frightened animal) - maybe bening down a bit?

19.speaker: Vanra
19.context: NodeContext: catatonic, staring dead ahead, repeats Mummy deadpan

15.speaker: Lora
15.text: I'm so sorry, my sweet girl. I'm so sorry I couldn't protect you.
15.context: NodeContext: trying not to cry, feels like she's failed as a mother (bending down a bit maybe? same as previous line)

61.speaker: Player
61.context: NodeContext: speaking to player, sad shake of her head

32.speaker: Lora
32.text: No. Just 'Mummy' - over and over again.
32.context: NodeContext: speaking to player, sad shake of her head

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I've come to collect my reward for saving your kid.
43.context: NodeContext: speaking t player, shake as she brushed off her unshed tears

41.speaker: Lora
41.context: NodeContext: speaking t player, shake as she brushed off her unshed tears

30.speaker: Lora
30.text: Yes it is. I'm her mother - I'm supposed to keep her safe.

42.speaker: Lora
42.text: I'll fix her. I don't care if I have to trek to the Moonshae Isles and back to find a cure.

65.speaker: Lora
65.text: Here - a token from the pirate life I left behind.
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving VanraNodeContext: generic handing gesture, small sad smile

53.speaker: Lora
53.text: Here - a token from the pirate life I left behind.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lora hands players an item as a reward for saving VanraNodeContext: generic handing gesture, small sad smile

39.speaker: Lora
39.text: Thank you, for bringing Vanra back to me. We're gonna get help for you, sweet girl, all right?
39.context: NodeContext: first line for player, second to vanra - that genlt voice, like she's a frightened animal

7.speaker: Lora
7.text: Oh no. I'm sorry, I had something for you - a paltry token, but it's gone. I'm ashamed that I have nothing but thanks to give you.
7.context: NodeContext: patting pockets (she's been pickpoketed) embarassed

73.speaker: Lora
73.text: Do you make a point of walking into strangers houses?
73.context: NodeContext: player has essentially just walking into her house, bemused

69.speaker: Vanra
69.context: NodeContext: loudly and boldly, like the player isn't staring directly in front of her.

71.speaker: Vanra
71.text: I don't like them, mummy. They look weird.
71.context: NodeContext: loudly and boldly, like the player isn't staring directly in front of her.

36.speaker: Lora
36.text: You heard her. I'm sure you can find the door.

50.speaker: Lora
50.text: Go on. I'm sure you can find the door.
